content:
I tried to follow the steps for making a patch release (https://docs.wasmtime.dev/contributing-release-process.html#releasing-a-patch-version) but after merging the release PR an hour ago (https://github.com/bytecodealliance/wasmtime/pull/6566) it seems like nothing further has happened. I can't dig into this further today but maybe somebody else can figure out why the [automatically-tag-and-release-this-commit] magic comment didn't do anything, or how to poke CI to get it to make the release?

Release Wasmtime 9.0.4 by wasmtime-publish · Pull Request #6566 · bytecodealliance/wasmtime
This is an automated pull request from CI to create a patch release for Wasmtime 9.0.4, requested by @jameysharp. It's recommended that maintainers double-check that RELEASES.md is up-to-date and t...

ah this ran afoul of the github actions issues today, the CI for the merge commit didn't complete and didn't make it to the "push tags" step. Retrying that CI though should work (I'll leave that to you for tomorrow though)

Release Wasmtime 9.0.4 (#6566) · bytecodealliance/wasmtime@6842d0d
A fast and secure runtime for WebAssembly. Contribute to bytecodealliance/wasmtime development by creating an account on GitHub.
Thanks Alex! I couldn't find the right run to poke when I was looking yesterday, for some reason, but it seems to have worked now. :tada:
Jamey Sharp has marked this topic as resolved.
